title: Domain 3.4: Explain the importance of resilience and recovery in security architecture.
content:
♻️ High Availability

  • ⚖️ Load Balancing: Distributes traffic across multiple systems to ensure performance and uptime.
  • 👥 Clustering: Group of systems acting as one. If one fails, another takes over seamlessly.

🏢 Site Considerations

  • 🔥 Hot Site: Fully equipped and ready for immediate use.
  • ❄️ Cold Site: Basic infrastructure only—needs full setup before use.
  • 🌡️ Warm Site: Partially ready—faster than cold, slower than hot.
  • 🌍 Geographic Dispersion: Spread resources across regions to avoid regional outages.

🧬 Platform Diversity & ☁️ Multi-Cloud

  • 🧬 Platform Diversity: Use varied systems/hardware to avoid single points of failure.
  • ☁️ Multi-Cloud Systems: Use multiple cloud vendors for greater resilience.

🔄 Continuity of Operations

  • Ensure mission-critical functions continue during disruption.

📏 Capacity Planning

  • 🧑 People: Sufficient trained staff.
  • 🧰 Technology: Scalable systems for peak demand.
  • 🏗️ Infrastructure: Strong foundation—network, power, etc.

🧪 Testing

  • 🗂️ Tabletop Exercises: Walkthrough with team.
  • 🔁 Failover: Test automatic switch to backup.
  • 🕹️ Simulation: Mock scenarios to test readiness.
  • 🧮 Parallel Processing: Run backups alongside live systems.

💾 Backups

  • 🏠 Onsite / Offsite: Local is faster; remote is safer.
  • 🔁 Frequency: Determines data loss window.
  • 🔐 Encryption: Protects backup confidentiality.
  • 🖼️ Snapshots: Quick point-in-time system state.
  • 🔄 Recovery: Restore from backup—must be tested!
  • 📡 Replication: Duplicates data to another site.
  • 📓 Journaling: Logs every change for complete recovery.

⚡ Power

  • 🔋 Generators: Long-term emergency power.
  • 🔌 UPS: Short-term battery backup—buys time to shut down safely.
